query: I have an existing n8n node at version 1 and need to add a version 2 that introduces a new 'upsert' operation on the contact resource while keeping backward compatibility with v1. How should I structure the versioned node?
expected_behavior: Creates a base node class extending VersionedNodeType
Defines nodeVersions map: { 1: new MyNodeV1(), 2: new MyNodeV2() }
Creates separate V1 and V2 node classes each implementing INodeType
V1 class preserves all existing behavior unmodified
V2 class adds the new upsert operation to the contact resource
Uses INodeTypeBaseDescription in the base class
Each version class has its own complete INodeTypeDescription
Version files in V1/ and V2/ subdirectories or named with version suffix
Main node file acts as router between versions
baseline_without_skill: Agent may modify v1 directly (breaking backward compatibility), skip VersionedNodeType, create incorrect version routing, or not understand the versioning pattern.
with_skill_expected: Agent produces a correctly versioned node structure with VersionedNodeType base, separate version implementations, and proper backward compatibility.
